sen.j: 与保呂川（よほろがわ）は、京都府舞鶴市を流れる二級水系の川。
sen.e: Yohoro-gawa River, class B river system, runs through Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Yohoro-gawa River is a class B river system which runs through Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Yohoro-gawa River belongs to a class B river system which runs through Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
It is the biggest river in Higashi Maizuru.
It is the biggest river in Higashi Maizuru.
It is the biggest river in Higashi Maizuru.

sen.j: 京都府舞鶴市と綾部市を隔てる養老山 (京都府)（標高665m）に源を発し、東舞鶴を通り舞鶴湾へ注ぐ。
sen.e: Yohoro-gawa River rises in Mt. Yoro (Kyoto Prefecture) (665m above sea level) on the border between Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and Ayabe City, and runs into the Maizuru Bay through Higashi Maizuru.

Yohoro-gawa River begins in Mt. Yoro (Kyoto Prefecture) (665m above sea level) on the border between Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and Ayabe City, and runs into the Maizuru Bay through Higashi Maizuru.

Yohoro-gawa River begins in Mt. Yoro (Kyoto Prefecture) (665m above sea level) on the border between Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture, and Ayabe City, and runs into the Maizuru Bay through Higashi Maizuru.

sen.j: 流域では堤防などに桜並木が設置されており、春の観桜シーズンには多くの観光客が訪れる。
sen.e: A row of cherry trees is planted at an embankment of its basin, and many tourists visit in the season of cherry-blossom viewing.
A row of cherry trees is planted at an embankment at its basin, and many tourists visit this location during the cherry-blossom viewing season.
A row of cherry trees is planted at an embankment at its basin, and many tourists visit this location during the cherry-blossom viewing season.

tit.cmt: スペルミスを訂正しました。

sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture
Kyoto Prefecture

Maizuru City

Navy and riverhead of Yohoro-gawa River
The Navy and Source of the Yohoro-gawa River
The Navy and Source of the Yohoro-gawa River

sen.j: 1901年(明治34年)に舞鶴鎮守府が創設され、日本海側唯一の軍港として発展した歴史を持つ舞鶴市であるが、鎮守府創設にあわせる形で1898年(明治31年)に軍事水道の建設が開始され、1900年(明治33年)に与保呂川上流に桂貯水池が完成。
sen.e: Maizuru City has a history of having developed as the only military port along the Japan Sea after Maizuru Chinjugu (Maizuru Naval District) was established in 1901; however, for the purpose of completion before the establishment of Chinjufu, the construction of water system for military use started in 1898, and the Katsura reservoir was completed upstream of Yohoro-gawa River.

Maizuru City has a history of being developed as the only military port along the Japan Sea after Maizuru Chinjugu (Maizuru Naval District) was established in 1901; however, in order to complete its construction before the establishment of Chinjufu, the construction of the military water system started in 1898, and the Katsura reservoir was completed upstream of Yohoro-gawa River.

Maizuru City has a history of being developed as the only military port along the Japan Sea after Maizuru Chinjufu (Maizuru Naval District) was established in 1901; however, in order to complete its construction before the establishment of Chinjufu, the construction of the military water system started in 1898, and the Katsura reservoir was completed upstream of Yohoro-gawa River.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを訂正しました。

sen.j: さらに1905年(明治38年)には岸谷貯水池が完成し、与保呂川自体が軍事水道として活用された。
sen.e: In addition, the Kishidani reservoir was completed in 1905, and Yohoro-gawa River itself was utilized as a water system for military use.
In addition, the Kishidani reservoir was completed in 1905, and the Yohoro-gawa River itself was utilized as a water system by the military.
In addition, the Kishidani reservoir was completed in 1905, and the Yohoro-gawa River itself was utilized as a water system by the military.

sen.j: 現在では舞鶴市の与保呂地区をはじめ、東舞鶴全域で飲料水用や農耕用として利用されている。
sen.e: The river water is now used for drinking and agriculture not only in the Yohoro district of Maizuru City, and in the whole area of Higashi Maizuru.
The river water is now used for drinking and agriculture not only in the Yohoro district of Maizuru City, but across the whole area of Higashi Maizuru.
The river water is now used for drinking and agriculture not only in the Yohoro district of Maizuru City, but across the whole area of Higashi Maizuru.
